metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23975 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The developer page about:memory has a Measure function for exploring what object types the browser has allocated and their sizes. When this function was invoked we incorrectly called the sizeof function, instead of using the API method that checks for invalid pointers. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 86.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23975` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 86.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 86.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 86.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '86.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
